text: when you're using open Wi-Fi your
communication is over radio in the
Claire it's trivial to intercept this
data oh it's simple to basically set up
on your wireless card in monitor mode
and they have lots of tools available
that you could download on the internet
like air crack and air Aman that allow
you to basically bet your wireless card
what we call promiscuous mode so any of
the packets that are you know being
transmitted by radio to the air you
could decode and display on your
computer now if somebody is accessing
their you know Gmail accounts and it's
using SSL which stands for Secure
Sockets Layer you see the little padlock
in the browser then the attacker won't
be able to see those communications
because from point to point it's
encrypted but there's lots of other
types of communications for an attacker
that potentially gets not only access to
your computer but access to private
information instead of using the public
Wi-Fi you should just get your own
portable internet device and configure
it that you have to use a password like
the wpa2 key to connect to it that's the
safest way but if you must use open
Wi-Fi it's a risk unless you set up a
VPN service so what's the VPN service it
stands for virtual private network you
could get access to a VPN service for
like 60 bucks a year there's only $5 a
month what a VPN does is anything from
your client whether it's your phone your
tablet or your computer all the way to
the VPN provider you're using is
encrypted so an attacker cannot use drop
other's communications or infect the
integrity of those communications
you
